source: In 2006, The Underdogs produced the soundtrack to the motion picture "Dreamgirls" which won the Critic's Choice Award in 2007 for best movie soundtrack. In 2012 The Underdogs produced the vocals for the film "Pitch Perfect", starring Anna Kendrick and Brittany Snow. In 2015, The Underdogs produced the music for the sequel to the moderately successful "Pitch Perfect" movie, "Pitch Perfect 2" and the highly acclaimed film "Straight Outta Compton" about the rap group N.W.A. In 2012, Mason Jr. was the last producer to work with Whitney Houston when he produced the songs "His Eye Is on the Sparrow" and "Celebrate" for the movie Sparkle. Following the success of Pitch Perfect 2, Get On Up, and Straight Outta Compton, Harvey served as music producer for the NBC broadcast of The Wiz Live! which aired on December 3, 2015, and he produced over 50 songs for the animated musical SING from Universal/Illumination Entertainment which was released on December 3, 2016.

input_lines: ["GCW, owned primarily by Jack Brisco and Gerald Brisco and booked by Ole Anderson, was the first NWA territory to gain cable television access, being broadcast on Channel 17 of Ted Turner's Superstation TBS.", 'Jim Crockett Promotions was purchased outright by Turner on October 11, 1988.', 'Originally incorporated by TBS as the Universal Wrestling Corporation, Turner promised fans that WCW would maintain the athlete-oriented style of the NWA.', 'The sale was completed on November 2, 1988, with a television taping of "NWA World Championship Wrestling" that very same date in WCW\'s hometown of Atlanta.']

source: GCW, owned primarily by Jack Brisco and Gerald Brisco and booked by Ole Anderson, was the first NWA territory to gain cable television access, being broadcast on Channel 17 of Ted Turner's Superstation TBS. Jim Crockett Promotions was purchased outright by Turner on October 11, 1988. Originally incorporated by TBS as the Universal Wrestling Corporation, Turner promised fans that WCW would maintain the athlete-oriented style of the NWA. The sale was completed on November 2, 1988, with a television taping of "NWA World Championship Wrestling" that very same date in WCW's hometown of Atlanta.

input_lines: ['Although the "World Championship Wrestling" brand name was used by promoter Jim Barnett for his Australian promotion, the first promotion in the United States to use the brand on a wide scale was Georgia Championship Wrestling (GCW).', "GCW, owned primarily by Jack Brisco and Gerald Brisco and booked by Ole Anderson, was the first NWA territory to gain cable television access, being broadcast on Channel 17 of Ted Turner's Superstation TBS.", 'In 1982, GCW changed the name of its television show to "World Championship Wrestling" since it was already starting to run shows in "neutral" territories such as Ohio, Pennsylvania and Michigan.']

source: Although the "World Championship Wrestling" brand name was used by promoter Jim Barnett for his Australian promotion, the first promotion in the United States to use the brand on a wide scale was Georgia Championship Wrestling (GCW). GCW, owned primarily by Jack Brisco and Gerald Brisco and booked by Ole Anderson, was the first NWA territory to gain cable television access, being broadcast on Channel 17 of Ted Turner's Superstation TBS. In 1982, GCW changed the name of its television show to "World Championship Wrestling" since it was already starting to run shows in "neutral" territories such as Ohio, Pennsylvania and Michigan.

input_lines: ['Kathy Corrigan', 'In the general election, in May 2009, Corrigan defeated BC Liberals candidate Nuraney and BC Green Party candidate and retired business consultant Bruce Friesen, though the BC Liberals won a renewed majority government, with the NDP as the official opposition.', 'As the 39th Parliament began, she was appointed to the Select Standing Committee on Public Accounts in all four sessions.', 'Corrigan sought re-election in the 2013 provincial election.', 'She was challenged by medical doctor Shian Gu for the BC Liberals and school teacher Rick McGowan  for the BC Greens but was projected to easily win the riding.', 'In 2016, the 62-year old Corrigan announced that she would not be seeking reelection in upcoming 2017 provincial election.']
summary_sent: Kathy Corrigan is a Canadian politician who served in the 39th and 40th Parliament of British Columbia, from 2009 to 2017.
source: Kathy Corrigan In the general election, in May 2009, Corrigan defeated BC Liberals candidate Nuraney and BC Green Party candidate and retired business consultant Bruce Friesen, though the BC Liberals won a renewed majority government, with the NDP as the official opposition. As the 39th Parliament began, she was appointed to the Select Standing Committee on Public Accounts in all four sessions. Corrigan sought re-election in the 2013 provincial election. She was challenged by medical doctor Shian Gu for the BC Liberals and school teacher Rick McGowan  for the BC Greens but was projected to easily win the riding. In 2016, the 62-year old Corrigan announced that she would not be seeking reelection in upcoming 2017 provincial election.

source: Kathy Corrigan In the general election, in May 2009, Corrigan defeated BC Liberals candidate Nuraney and BC Green Party candidate and retired business consultant Bruce Friesen, though the BC Liberals won a renewed majority government, with the NDP as the official opposition. As the 39th Parliament began, she was appointed to the Select Standing Committee on Public Accounts in all four sessions. Corrigan sought re-election in the 2013 provincial election. She was challenged by medical doctor Shian Gu for the BC Liberals and school teacher Rick McGowan  for the BC Greens but was projected to easily win the riding. In 2016, the 62-year old Corrigan announced that she would not be seeking reelection in upcoming 2017 provincial election.

input_lines: ['Vojislav Mihailović', "Mihailović was born on 3 September 1951 in Belgrade, in the PR Serbia, Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia.", 'Following the vacancy period, Mihailović was elected Mayor of Belgrade on 22 January 1999.', 'Mihailović ran as SPO candidate for President of Federal Republic Yugoslavia in the 2000 Yugoslav general elections, winning 2.95% of the popular vote.', 'In 2018, Mihailović joined the Movement for the Restoration of the Kingdom of Serbia, another break-away faction of SPO.', "Mihailović's faction held an assembly in Belgrade on 3 January 2022 and elected Mihailović as president of POKS."]
summary_sent: Vojislav Mihailović (born 3 September 1951) is a Serbian politician who served as the mayor of Belgrade from 1999 to 2000 and the president of the Movement for the Restoration of the Kingdom of Serbia (POKS) since 3 January 2022.
source: Vojislav Mihailović Mihailović was born on 3 September 1951 in Belgrade, in the PR Serbia, Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia. Following the vacancy period, Mihailović was elected Mayor of Belgrade on 22 January 1999. Mihailović ran as SPO candidate for President of Federal Republic Yugoslavia in the 2000 Yugoslav general elections, winning 2.95% of the popular vote. In 2018, Mihailović joined the Movement for the Restoration of the Kingdom of Serbia, another break-away faction of SPO. Mihailović's faction held an assembly in Belgrade on 3 January 2022 and elected Mihailović as president of POKS.

source: Bilson's father comes from a show business family; he is the son of Mona (Weichman) and producer-director Bruce Bilson (b. 1928). Bilson's classmates at Notre Dame High School in Sherman Oaks, California, included actress Kirsten Dunst, actor Rami Malek, and "American Idol" runner-up singer Katharine McPhee. Bilson was subsequently cast in "The O.C.", which debuted in August 2003. Her character, Summer Roberts, was initially intended to appear in only a few episodes but became a series regular after a successful run, as Bilson's on-screen romance with Seth Cohen (Adam Brody) became a noted aspect of the series. Bilson's first film role was in "The Last Kiss", a romantic comedy-drama also starring Zach Braff in 2006. In late 2006, Bilson was cast in the film Doug Liman's thriller "Jumper", as the replacement for actress Teresa Palmer; the film was released on February 14, 2008. After she and Brody broke up, Bilson began a relationship with actor Hayden Christensen, with whom she co-starred on the film "Jumper".

input_lines: ['He founded Gamma Ray, a group more centered on his unique style and tastes, in 1996.', 'After a cease and desist from a band of the same name, this band became Queens of the Stone Age.', "Homme had asked a number of singers, including Lanegan, to perform as lead vocalist for Queens of the Stone Age, but by the time of recording the band's debut album, he had moved back to Palm Desert and the band was pared down to just Homme and ex-Kyuss drummer Alfredo Hernandez.", 'Homme was left to cover every other instrument and ended up singing for the first time in his career.', 'Homme began writing the band\'s next album, "Lullabies to Paralyze", named after a lyric from the "Songs for the Deaf" hidden track "Mosquito Song".', 'He used the name "Carlo Von Sexron" to credit his bass, keyboard, piano, and drums playing on albums such as "The Desert Sessions Volumes 3 & 4", "Queens of the Stone Age", and "Peace, Love, Death Metal".']
summary_sent: He is known as the founder and songwriter of the rock band Queens of the Stone Age, which he formed in 1996 and in which he sings lead vocals covered other instruments.
source: He founded Gamma Ray, a group more centered on his unique style and tastes, in 1996. After a cease and desist from a band of the same name, this band became Queens of the Stone Age. Homme had asked a number of singers, including Lanegan, to perform as lead vocalist for Queens of the Stone Age, but by the time of recording the band's debut album, he had moved back to Palm Desert and the band was pared down to just Homme and ex-Kyuss drummer Alfredo Hernandez. Homme was left to cover every other instrument and ended up singing for the first time in his career. Homme began writing the band's next album, "Lullabies to Paralyze", named after a lyric from the "Songs for the Deaf" hidden track "Mosquito Song". He used the name "Carlo Von Sexron" to credit his bass, keyboard, piano, and drums playing on albums such as "The Desert Sessions Volumes 3 & 4", "Queens of the Stone Age", and "Peace, Love, Death Metal".

source: He founded Gamma Ray, a group more centered on his unique style and tastes, in 1996. After a cease and desist from a band of the same name, this band became Queens of the Stone Age. Homme had asked a number of singers, including Lanegan, to perform as lead vocalist for Queens of the Stone Age, but by the time of recording the band's debut album, he had moved back to Palm Desert and the band was pared down to just Homme and ex-Kyuss drummer Alfredo Hernandez. Homme was left to cover every other instrument and ended up singing for the first time in his career. Homme began writing the band's next album, "Lullabies to Paralyze", named after a lyric from the "Songs for the Deaf" hidden track "Mosquito Song". He used the name "Carlo Von Sexron" to credit his bass, keyboard, piano, and drums playing on albums such as "The Desert Sessions Volumes 3 & 4", "Queens of the Stone Age", and "Peace, Love, Death Metal".

input_lines: ['In 1987, when he was 14 years old, Homme formed a punk rock-influenced heavy metal band in  Palm Desert High School called Katzenjammer with schoolmates John Garcia, Brant Bjork, Nick Oliveri and Chris Cockrell.', "Homme was the band's guitarist.", 'After changing their name a few times, first to Sons of Kyuss (they released an EP of the same name), they finally shortened it to Kyuss.', 'When Kyuss split up in 1995, Homme moved to Seattle, Washington, briefly abandoning his desire for a music career and attending the University of Washington to study business.']
summary_sent: Homme was formerly the guitarist of the rock band Kyuss from 1987 to 1995.
source: In 1987, when he was 14 years old, Homme formed a punk rock-influenced heavy metal band in  Palm Desert High School called Katzenjammer with schoolmates John Garcia, Brant Bjork, Nick Oliveri and Chris Cockrell. Homme was the band's guitarist. After changing their name a few times, first to Sons of Kyuss (they released an EP of the same name), they finally shortened it to Kyuss. When Kyuss split up in 1995, Homme moved to Seattle, Washington, briefly abandoning his desire for a music career and attending the University of Washington to study business.

When Kyuss split up in 1995, Homme moved to Seattle, Washington, briefly abandoning his desire for a music career and attending the University of Washington to study business.

input_lines: ['Bruce Vincent Rauner', 'Bruce Rauner was born in Chicago and grew up in Deerfield, Illinois, a suburb 10 miles north of Chicago city limits.', 'Rauner was the chairman of private equity firm GTCR, where he had worked for more than 30 years, starting in 1981 after his graduation from Harvard through his retirement in October 2012.', 'On March 20, 2018, Rauner narrowly won the Republican primary, with 51.4% of the vote; Ives received 48.6% of the vote.', 'In the November general election, Rauner lost to Democratic nominee J. B. Pritzker; Pritzker received 54% of the vote while Rauner received 39%.', 'Rauner was sworn in as Governor of Illinois on January 12, 2015.', 'Rauner was awarded the 2008 Distinguished Philanthropist award by the Chicago Association of Fundraising Professionals.']
summary_sent: Bruce Vincent Rauner is an American businessman, philanthropist, and politician who served as the governor of Illinois starting from 2015 and was defeated in the 2018 election.
source: Bruce Vincent Rauner Bruce Rauner was born in Chicago and grew up in Deerfield, Illinois, a suburb 10 miles north of Chicago city limits. Rauner was the chairman of private equity firm GTCR, where he had worked for more than 30 years, starting in 1981 after his graduation from Harvard through his retirement in October 2012. On March 20, 2018, Rauner narrowly won the Republican primary, with 51.4% of the vote; Ives received 48.6% of the vote. In the November general election, Rauner lost to Democratic nominee J. B. Pritzker; Pritzker received 54% of the vote while Rauner received 39%. Rauner was sworn in as Governor of Illinois on January 12, 2015. Rauner was awarded the 2008 Distinguished Philanthropist award by the Chicago Association of Fundraising Professionals.

input_lines: ['Lenka Kripac', 'The daughter of Czech-born jazz trumpet musician, Jiří Křipač and Australian schoolteacher, Eden, Lenka was raised in the Australian coastal town of Bega until age seven, when her family moved to Sydney, where she received her schooling, acting and music training, and started to work as a highly regarded theatre actress and later musician.', 'Lenka provided the vocals for 2 tracks on Paul Mac\'s 2005 album "Panic Room".', 'After adopting her first name as her sole artistic name, Lenka released her eponymous debut album on 24 September 2008, with "The Show" (produced by Stuart Brawley) chosen to be the first single release from the set.']

input_lines: ['Geraldo Rivera', 'Rivera was born at Beth Israel Medical Center in New York City, New York, the son of Lillian (née Friedman; October 16, 1924 – June 3, 2018) and Cruz "Allen" Rivera (October 1, 1915 – November 1987), a restaurant worker and cab driver respectively.', 'When I was born, my mother filled in my birth certificate with the name Gerald Riviera, adding an extra "i" to my father\'s surname.', 'After working with such organizations as the lower Manhattan-based Community Action for Legal Services and the National Lawyers Guild, Rivera became a frequent attorney for the East Harlem-based New York City chapter of the Young Lords, a Puerto Rican activist group, eventually precipitating his entry into private practice.', 'Rivera was hired by WABC-TV in 1970 as a reporter for "Eyewitness News".', 'In 1987, Rivera began producing and hosting the daytime talk show "Geraldo", which ran for 11 years.', 'In 2008, Rivera\'s book, titled "HisPanic: Why Americans Fear Hispanics in the U.S.", was released.', 'Rivera hosted the newsmagazine program "Geraldo at Large" and appears regularly on Fox News.']
summary_sent: Geraldo Rivera (born Gerald Riviera) is an American journalist, attorney, author, political commentator, and former television host.
source: Geraldo Rivera Rivera was born at Beth Israel Medical Center in New York City, New York, the son of Lillian (née Friedman; October 16, 1924 – June 3, 2018) and Cruz "Allen" Rivera (October 1, 1915 – November 1987), a restaurant worker and cab driver respectively. When I was born, my mother filled in my birth certificate with the name Gerald Riviera, adding an extra "i" to my father's surname. After working with such organizations as the lower Manhattan-based Community Action for Legal Services and the National Lawyers Guild, Rivera became a frequent attorney for the East Harlem-based New York City chapter of the Young Lords, a Puerto Rican activist group, eventually precipitating his entry into private practice. Rivera was hired by WABC-TV in 1970 as a reporter for "Eyewitness News". In 1987, Rivera began producing and hosting the daytime talk show "Geraldo", which ran for 11 years. In 2008, Rivera's book, titled "HisPanic: Why Americans Fear Hispanics in the U.S.", was released. Rivera hosted the newsmagazine program "Geraldo at Large" and appears regularly on Fox News.

Christa Luft was one of the 66 SED/PDS members, elected for the Karl-Marx-Stadt (previously and subsequently Chemnitz) electoral district.

input_lines: ['Richard Anthony "Cheech" Marin', 'Marin was born on July 13, 1946 in South Los Angeles, California, to Mexican-American parents Elsa (née Meza) (1923-2010), a secretary, and Oscar Marin (1922-2015), a police officer for the LAPD.', 'Marin met his future comedic partner, Tommy Chong, in Calgary, Alberta.', 'As a part of the highly successful comedy duo Cheech & Chong, Marin participated in a number of comedy albums and feature film comedies in the 1970s and 1980s.', 'Marin has released two best-selling albums in the children\'s music genre, "My Name is Cheech, the School Bus Driver" (1992) and "My Name is Cheech, The School Bus Driver "Coast to Coast" (1997).']

input_lines: ['Damiano Tommasi', 'Born in Negrar, Province of Verona, Tommasi started his professional career with local club Hellas Verona FC, in Serie B. He made his Serie A debut on 7 September 1996 with A.S. Roma in a 3–1 win over Piacenza Calcio, and would be an instrumental figure in the side\'s 2001 conquest of the "scudetto", with manager Fabio Capello even labelling him as the team\'s most important player.', 'In October 2021, it was announced Tommasi would run as the centre-left candidate for mayor of Verona for the 2022 election.', 'After qualifying to the second round with around 40% of votes, on 26 June 2022 Tommasi won the runoff with over 54% of the vote over outgoing right-wing mayor Federico Sboarina in the traditionally right-wing city.']
summary_sent: Damiano Tommasi is an Italian former footballer and current Mayor of Verona.
source: Damiano Tommasi Born in Negrar, Province of Verona, Tommasi started his professional career with local club Hellas Verona FC, in Serie B. He made his Serie A debut on 7 September 1996 with A.S. Roma in a 3–1 win over Piacenza Calcio, and would be an instrumental figure in the side's 2001 conquest of the "scudetto", with manager Fabio Capello even labelling him as the team's most important player. In October 2021, it was announced Tommasi would run as the centre-left candidate for mayor of Verona for the 2022 election. After qualifying to the second round with around 40% of votes, on 26 June 2022 Tommasi won the runoff with over 54% of the vote over outgoing right-wing mayor Federico Sboarina in the traditionally right-wing city.

input_lines: ['Born in Negrar, Province of Verona, Tommasi started his professional career with local club Hellas Verona FC, in Serie B. He made his Serie A debut on 7 September 1996 with A.S. Roma in a 3–1 win over Piacenza Calcio, and would be an instrumental figure in the side\'s 2001 conquest of the "scudetto", with manager Fabio Capello even labelling him as the team\'s most important player.', 'After ten years with the club, in July 2006 he joined Levante UD in Spain, spending two seasons with the La Liga strugglers, eventually ending in relegation in 2007–08.', "On 9 January 2009, his contract was terminated by mutual consent and, after advanced talks with Chinese Super League's Tianjin Teda, he signed for the club early in the following month, citing an interest in a third experience abroad as the main reason for it.", "A quick, strong, tenacious, consistent, hardworking and versatile player, Tommasi primarily excelled at breaking down his opponents' plays and intercepting passes as a box-to-box or defensive midfielder, due to his stamina and hard-tackling style of play."]
summary_sent: A defensive midfielder during his footballing years, after a decade at Roma – winning the 2001 Serie A title – he continued his career abroad, going on to play for teams in three countries.
source: Born in Negrar, Province of Verona, Tommasi started his professional career with local club Hellas Verona FC, in Serie B. He made his Serie A debut on 7 September 1996 with A.S. Roma in a 3–1 win over Piacenza Calcio, and would be an instrumental figure in the side's 2001 conquest of the "scudetto", with manager Fabio Capello even labelling him as the team's most important player. After ten years with the club, in July 2006 he joined Levante UD in Spain, spending two seasons with the La Liga strugglers, eventually ending in relegation in 2007–08. On 9 January 2009, his contract was terminated by mutual consent and, after advanced talks with Chinese Super League's Tianjin Teda, he signed for the club early in the following month, citing an interest in a third experience abroad as the main reason for it. A quick, strong, tenacious, consistent, hardworking and versatile player, Tommasi primarily excelled at breaking down his opponents' plays and intercepting passes as a box-to-box or defensive midfielder, due to his stamina and hard-tackling style of play.

source: Born in Negrar, Province of Verona, Tommasi started his professional career with local club Hellas Verona FC, in Serie B. He made his Serie A debut on 7 September 1996 with A.S. Roma in a 3–1 win over Piacenza Calcio, and would be an instrumental figure in the side's 2001 conquest of the "scudetto", with manager Fabio Capello even labelling him as the team's most important player. After ten years with the club, in July 2006 he joined Levante UD in Spain, spending two seasons with the La Liga strugglers, eventually ending in relegation in 2007–08. On 9 January 2009, his contract was terminated by mutual consent and, after advanced talks with Chinese Super League's Tianjin Teda, he signed for the club early in the following month, citing an interest in a third experience abroad as the main reason for it. A quick, strong, tenacious, consistent, hardworking and versatile player, Tommasi primarily excelled at breaking down his opponents' plays and intercepting passes as a box-to-box or defensive midfielder, due to his stamina and hard-tackling style of play.

input_lines: ['Dreamer joined Extreme Championship Wrestling (ECW) in October 1993 at NWA Bloodfest.', 'After ECW closed its doors, Dreamer spent time in various independent leagues throughout the country, such as Jersey All Pro Wrestling and Combat Zone Wrestling before he signed with the World Wrestling Federation (WWF).', 'He was introduced to WWF audiences on the July 9, 2001 episode of "Raw" as a member of the WCW/ECW Alliance during the Invasion angle.', 'He was brought back to the main roster of the now renamed World Wrestling Entertainment in March and placed on the Raw brand.', 'A few days later on January 4, 2010, Dreamer was officially released by WWE, ending an eight-year tenure with the company.']

source: Dreamer joined Extreme Championship Wrestling (ECW) in October 1993 at NWA Bloodfest. After ECW closed its doors, Dreamer spent time in various independent leagues throughout the country, such as Jersey All Pro Wrestling and Combat Zone Wrestling before he signed with the World Wrestling Federation (WWF). He was introduced to WWF audiences on the July 9, 2001 episode of "Raw" as a member of the WCW/ECW Alliance during the Invasion angle. He was brought back to the main roster of the now renamed World Wrestling Entertainment in March and placed on the Raw brand. A few days later on January 4, 2010, Dreamer was officially released by WWE, ending an eight-year tenure with the company.

After ECW closed its doors, Dreamer spent time in various independent leagues throughout the country, such as Jersey All Pro Wrestling and Combat Zone Wrestling before he signed with the World Wrestling Federation (WWF). He was introduced to WWF audiences on the July 9, 2001 episode of "Raw" as a member of the WCW/ECW Alliance during the Invasion angle. He was brought back to the main roster of the now renamed World Wrestling Entertainment in March and placed on the Raw brand. A few days later on January 4, 2010, Dreamer was officially released by WWE, ending an eight-year tenure with the company.

source: Shortall was first elected to Dáil Éireann at the 1992 general election, when the Labour Party won a record 33 seats as part of the "Spring Tide", a surge credited to the popularity of Labour leader Dick Spring. She retained her seat at each of the following four general elections.

input_lines: ['In 1988, she joined the Labour Party and first held public office in 1991, when she was elected to Dublin City Council for the Drumcondra local electoral area.', 'She resigned as Minister of State for Primary Care on 26 September 2012, and also resigned the Parliamentary Labour Party whip.', 'On 15 July 2015, Shortall launched the Social Democrats party along with fellow Independent TDs Stephen Donnelly and Catherine Murphy.']
summary_sent: A member of the Labour Party until 2012, she co-founded the Social Democrats in July 2015.
source: In 1988, she joined the Labour Party and first held public office in 1991, when she was elected to Dublin City Council for the Drumcondra local electoral area. She resigned as Minister of State for Primary Care on 26 September 2012, and also resigned the Parliamentary Labour Party whip. On 15 July 2015, Shortall launched the Social Democrats party along with fellow Independent TDs Stephen Donnelly and Catherine Murphy.

input_lines: ['Under election rules in California, the top two vote-getters in the March 3, 2020, primary, regardless of party affiliation, later faced each other in the general election.', 'Campa-Najjar placed first in the primary, and faced a November runoff election against Republican former Congressman Darrell Issa.', 'Polls show a competitive election in the 50th district, which the "Union-Tribune" described as "a statistical dead heat".', 'Campa-Najjar eventually lost in the 2020 election against Issa.']
summary_sent: Campa-Najjar lost again in a 2020 campaign to represent California's 50th congressional district.
source: Under election rules in California, the top two vote-getters in the March 3, 2020, primary, regardless of party affiliation, later faced each other in the general election. Campa-Najjar placed first in the primary, and faced a November runoff election against Republican former Congressman Darrell Issa. Polls show a competitive election in the 50th district, which the "Union-Tribune" described as "a statistical dead heat". Campa-Najjar eventually lost in the 2020 election against Issa.

input_lines: ['Also in 2004, Bendis oversaw the closing issues of "The Avengers" as part of the crossover storyline "Avengers Disassembled".', 'This led directly to the Bendis-helmed relaunch of one version of the eponymous team in the pages of "The New Avengers".', 'In 2005, with artist Olivier Coipel, Bendis wrote the New Avengers / X-Men crossover, "House of M", which would retroactively be considered the second act of a three-act super-event beginning with "Avengers Disassembled" and culminating in the Bendis-written 2008 storyline "Secret Invasion".', 'Bendis also wrote the storyline "Secret War", which was published between 2004 and 2005.', 'Bendis re-teamed with Olivier Coipel for the 2009 crossover series "Siege", which brought the "Dark Reign" storyline to a close, and with it "Dark Avengers".', 'Bendis wrote the "Age of Ultron" crossover storyline, which included an eponymous 10-issue miniseries, that was published between March and June 2013.']
summary_sent: He relaunched the Avengers franchise with "New Avengers", and also wrote the storylines "Secret War" (2004–2005), "House of M" (2005), "Secret Invasion" (2008), "Siege" (2009) and "Age of Ultron" (2013).
source: Also in 2004, Bendis oversaw the closing issues of "The Avengers" as part of the crossover storyline "Avengers Disassembled". This led directly to the Bendis-helmed relaunch of one version of the eponymous team in the pages of "The New Avengers". In 2005, with artist Olivier Coipel, Bendis wrote the New Avengers / X-Men crossover, "House of M", which would retroactively be considered the second act of a three-act super-event beginning with "Avengers Disassembled" and culminating in the Bendis-written 2008 storyline "Secret Invasion". Bendis also wrote the storyline "Secret War", which was published between 2004 and 2005. Bendis re-teamed with Olivier Coipel for the 2009 crossover series "Siege", which brought the "Dark Reign" storyline to a close, and with it "Dark Avengers". Bendis wrote the "Age of Ultron" crossover storyline, which included an eponymous 10-issue miniseries, that was published between March and June 2013.

input_lines: ['Also in 2004, Bendis oversaw the closing issues of "The Avengers" as part of the crossover storyline "Avengers Disassembled".', 'This led directly to the Bendis-helmed relaunch of one version of the eponymous team in the pages of "The New Avengers".', 'In 2005, with artist Olivier Coipel, Bendis wrote the New Avengers / X-Men crossover, "House of M", which would retroactively be considered the second act of a three-act super-event beginning with "Avengers Disassembled" and culminating in the Bendis-written 2008 storyline "Secret Invasion".', 'Bendis also wrote the storyline "Secret War", which was published between 2004 and 2005.', 'Bendis re-teamed with Olivier Coipel for the 2009 crossover series "Siege", which brought the "Dark Reign" storyline to a close, and with it "Dark Avengers".', 'Bendis wrote the "Age of Ultron" crossover storyline, which included an eponymous 10-issue miniseries, that was published between March and June 2013.']
summary_sent: He relaunched the Avengers franchise with "New Avengers" in 2004, and also wrote the Marvel storylines "Secret War" (2004–2005), "House of M" (2005), "Secret Invasion" (2008), "Siege" (2010) and "Age of Ultron" (2013).
source: Also in 2004, Bendis oversaw the closing issues of "The Avengers" as part of the crossover storyline "Avengers Disassembled". This led directly to the Bendis-helmed relaunch of one version of the eponymous team in the pages of "The New Avengers". In 2005, with artist Olivier Coipel, Bendis wrote the New Avengers / X-Men crossover, "House of M", which would retroactively be considered the second act of a three-act super-event beginning with "Avengers Disassembled" and culminating in the Bendis-written 2008 storyline "Secret Invasion". Bendis also wrote the storyline "Secret War", which was published between 2004 and 2005. Bendis re-teamed with Olivier Coipel for the 2009 crossover series "Siege", which brought the "Dark Reign" storyline to a close, and with it "Dark Avengers". Bendis wrote the "Age of Ultron" crossover storyline, which included an eponymous 10-issue miniseries, that was published between March and June 2013.

input_lines: ['Director Jane Campion was looking for a little girl to play a main role in "The Piano", set to film in New Zealand, and a newspaper advertisement was run announcing an open audition.', "When Campion met Paquin—whose only acting experience had been as a skunk in a school play—she was very impressed with the nine-year-old's performance of the monologue about Flora's father, and she was chosen from among the 5000 candidates.", 'When "The Piano" was released in 1993 it was lauded by critics, won prizes at a number of film festivals, and eventually became a popular film among a wide audience.', "Paquin's debut performance in the film earned her the 1993 Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress at the age of 11, making her the second-youngest Oscar winner in history, behind Tatum O'Neal."]
summary_sent: She made her acting debut in "The Piano" (1993), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress at age 11, making her the second-youngest winner in Oscar history.
source: Director Jane Campion was looking for a little girl to play a main role in "The Piano", set to film in New Zealand, and a newspaper advertisement was run announcing an open audition. When Campion met Paquin—whose only acting experience had been as a skunk in a school play—she was very impressed with the nine-year-old's performance of the monologue about Flora's father, and she was chosen from among the 5000 candidates. When "The Piano" was released in 1993 it was lauded by critics, won prizes at a number of film festivals, and eventually became a popular film among a wide audience. When Campion met Paquin—whose only acting experience had been as a skunk in a school play—she was very impressed with the nine-year-old's performance of the monologue about Flora's father, and she was chosen from among the 5000 candidates. When "The Piano" was released in 1993 it was lauded by critics, won prizes at a number of film festivals, and eventually became a popular film among a wide audience. Paquin's debut performance in the film earned her the 1993 Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress at the age of 11, making her the second-youngest Oscar winner in history, behind Tatum O'Neal.

input_lines: ['Joanne Dawn Coburn', 'Born in Hendon, Coburn was educated at the North London Collegiate School, an independent school for girls in northwest London, followed by the University of Manchester, where she studied History and German, and the University of Oxford, where she studied Middle Eastern politics.', 'After working as a regional correspondent for BBC London for four years, Coburn joined BBC Breakfast in 2001 as a political correspondent.', 'She spent some time presenting on the BBC News Channel, and three months as presenter of BBC Radio 4\'s political events programme "The World This Weekend".', 'Coburn joined BBC Two\'s weekday political programme "Daily Politics" in 2008, presenting the show alongside Andrew Neil on Thursdays.', 'Coburn also presented a companion show, "Politics Europe", and the regional opt-out, "Sunday Politics London".', 'She is married to former Downing Street head of strategic communications Mark Flanagan, has two children and lives in London.']

source: Joanne Dawn Coburn Born in Hendon, Coburn was educated at the North London Collegiate School, an independent school for girls in northwest London, followed by the University of Manchester, where she studied History and German, and the University of Oxford, where she studied Middle Eastern politics. After working as a regional correspondent for BBC London for four years, Coburn joined BBC Breakfast in 2001 as a political correspondent. She spent some time presenting on the BBC News Channel, and three months as presenter of BBC Radio 4's political events programme "The World This Weekend". Coburn joined BBC Two's weekday political programme "Daily Politics" in 2008, presenting the show alongside Andrew Neil on Thursdays. Coburn also presented a companion show, "Politics Europe", and the regional opt-out, "Sunday Politics London". She is married to former Downing Street head of strategic communications Mark Flanagan, has two children and lives in London.

input_lines: ['Bill Graham', "Graham grew up in Montreal, Quebec, and Vancouver, British Columbia, in a wealthy family; his father, Francis Ronald Graham Sr., was a business magnate and Honorary Colonel of the Vancouver Gunners, and Bill is a product of the second marriages of both parents (mother Helen Bailey was Graham's second wife).", 'He was educated at Upper Canada College, Trinity College at the University of Toronto, the University of Toronto Faculty of Law (where he was an editor of the "Law Review" and the gold medalist of 1964), and the University of Paris.', 'He also represented a Toronto law firm, Fasken and Calvin (known as Faskens) (where he had articled), in Europe.', 'He served as a member, and for six years as Chair, of the House of Commons Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs and International Trade (SCFAIT).', 'In 2007, he was elected Chancellor at Trinity College, Toronto.']

source: Bill Graham Graham grew up in Montreal, Quebec, and Vancouver, British Columbia, in a wealthy family; his father, Francis Ronald Graham Sr., was a business magnate and Honorary Colonel of the Vancouver Gunners, and Bill is a product of the second marriages of both parents (mother Helen Bailey was Graham's second wife). He was educated at Upper Canada College, Trinity College at the University of Toronto, the University of Toronto Faculty of Law (where he was an editor of the "Law Review" and the gold medalist of 1964), and the University of Paris. He also represented a Toronto law firm, Fasken and Calvin (known as Faskens) (where he had articled), in Europe. He served as a member, and for six years as Chair, of the House of Commons Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs and International Trade (SCFAIT). In 2007, he was elected Chancellor at Trinity College, Toronto.

input_lines: ['Gregor Florian Gysi', 'Gysi was born in Berlin-Lichtenberg in East Berlin, Soviet Zone of Germany.', 'In 1971 he became a licensed attorney, and during the 1970s and 1980s defended several prominent dissidents, including Rudolf Bahro, Robert Havemann, Ulrike Poppe, and Bärbel Bohley.', 'PDS, with Gysi at times sharing a platform with WASG leader Oskar Lafontaine, former finance minister (in the first months of the Schröder government) and formerly party leader of the SPD.', 'In June 2007, the PDS and WASG formally merged to form a united party called The Left.', 'In November 2014, after being invited by Inge Höger and Annette Groth, also members of The Left ("Die Linke") to talk with them in the Bundestag, journalists Max Blumenthal and David Sheen learned that Gysi tried to cancel the meetings on the grounds that Blumenthal and Sheen held extremist views from which he wished to dissociate the party.']
summary_sent: Gregor Florian Gysi is a German attorney and a prominent politician of The Left ("Die Linke") political party.
source: Gregor Florian Gysi Gysi was born in Berlin-Lichtenberg in East Berlin, Soviet Zone of Germany. In 1971 he became a licensed attorney, and during the 1970s and 1980s defended several prominent dissidents, including Rudolf Bahro, Robert Havemann, Ulrike Poppe, and Bärbel Bohley. PDS, with Gysi at times sharing a platform with WASG leader Oskar Lafontaine, former finance minister (in the first months of the Schröder government) and formerly party leader of the SPD. In June 2007, the PDS and WASG formally merged to form a united party called The Left. In November 2014, after being invited by Inge Höger and Annette Groth, also members of The Left ("Die Linke") to talk with them in the Bundestag, journalists Max Blumenthal and David Sheen learned that Gysi tried to cancel the meetings on the grounds that Blumenthal and Sheen held extremist views from which he wished to dissociate the party.

input_lines: ['Gregor Florian Gysi', 'Gysi was born in Berlin-Lichtenberg in East Berlin, Soviet Zone of Germany.', 'In 1971 he became a licensed attorney, and during the 1970s and 1980s defended several prominent dissidents, including Rudolf Bahro, Robert Havemann, Ulrike Poppe, and Bärbel Bohley.', 'PDS, with Gysi at times sharing a platform with WASG leader Oskar Lafontaine, former finance minister (in the first months of the Schröder government) and formerly party leader of the SPD.', 'In June 2007, the PDS and WASG formally merged to form a united party called The Left.', 'In November 2014, after being invited by Inge Höger and Annette Groth, also members of The Left ("Die Linke") to talk with them in the Bundestag, journalists Max Blumenthal and David Sheen learned that Gysi tried to cancel the meetings on the grounds that Blumenthal and Sheen held extremist views from which he wished to dissociate the party.']
summary_sent: Gregor Florian Gysi (; born 16 January 1948) is a German attorney, president of the Party of the European Left and a prominent politician of The Left ("Die Linke") political party.
source: Gregor Florian Gysi Gysi was born in Berlin-Lichtenberg in East Berlin, Soviet Zone of Germany. In 1971 he became a licensed attorney, and during the 1970s and 1980s defended several prominent dissidents, including Rudolf Bahro, Robert Havemann, Ulrike Poppe, and Bärbel Bohley. PDS, with Gysi at times sharing a platform with WASG leader Oskar Lafontaine, former finance minister (in the first months of the Schröder government) and formerly party leader of the SPD. In June 2007, the PDS and WASG formally merged to form a united party called The Left. In November 2014, after being invited by Inge Höger and Annette Groth, also members of The Left ("Die Linke") to talk with them in the Bundestag, journalists Max Blumenthal and David Sheen learned that Gysi tried to cancel the meetings on the grounds that Blumenthal and Sheen held extremist views from which he wished to dissociate the party.

On 16 December, the SED was renamed the Socialist Unity Party – Party of Democratic Socialism (SED-PDS), it later became simply the Party of Democratic Socialism (PDS). Gysi remained as party chairman, and in March 1990 was elected to the Volkskammer in the first free election of that body, serving there until it was dissolved upon German reunification on 3 October 1990.

input_lines: ['In "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge", Kajol\'s final 1995 release, she and Shah Rukh Khan starred as non-resident Indians from London who fall in love during a trip across Europe and reunite in India to persuade her conservative father to call off her upcoming arranged marriage.', 'One of the most successful films of all-time in India, it has been continuously running in Mumbai and, having surpassed 1000 weeks of screening in 2014, became the longest-running Indian film ever.', 'Equally popular with critics, the film earned ten Filmfare Awards, including a first Best Actress for Kajol.', 'The biggest success of 1998 for Kajol was her final release of that year, Karan Johar\'s directorial debut, "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai".', 'Kajol played Anjali Sharma, a tomboyish college student who is secretly in love with her best friend from college (Shah Rukh Khan).', 'She won her second Best Actress award at the 44th Filmfare Awards and first Zee Cine Award for Best Actor\xa0– Female for her work.']
summary_sent: Starring roles with Khan in the successful romances "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge" (1995) and "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai" (1998) established her as a leading star in the 1990s and earned her two Filmfare Awards for Best Actress.
source: In "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge", Kajol's final 1995 release, she and Shah Rukh Khan starred as non-resident Indians from London who fall in love during a trip across Europe and reunite in India to persuade her conservative father to call off her upcoming arranged marriage. One of the most successful films of all-time in India, it has been continuously running in Mumbai and, having surpassed 1000 weeks of screening in 2014, became the longest-running Indian film ever. Equally popular with critics, the film earned ten Filmfare Awards, including a first Best Actress for Kajol. The biggest success of 1998 for Kajol was her final release of that year, Karan Johar's directorial debut, "Kuch Kuch Hota Hai". Kajol played Anjali Sharma, a tomboyish college student who is secretly in love with her best friend from college (Shah Rukh Khan). She won her second Best Actress award at the 44th Filmfare Awards and first Zee Cine Award for Best Actor – Female for her work.

input_lines: ['Kunal Kohli\'s romantic thriller "Fanaa" (2006) marked Kajol\'s return to films.', '"Fanaa" fetched Kajol a fourth Filmfare Award and second Zee Cine Award for Best Actress.', 'Kajol was next cast opposite Shah Rukh Khan in "My Name Is Khan" (2010), based on the discrimination faced by American Muslims after the 9/11 terrorist attacks.', 'For the film, Kajol won her fifth Best Actress award at Filmfare, thereby sharing the record with her late aunt, Nutan.']

input_lines: ['Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth', 'Neuwirth was born in Newark, New Jersey.', 'Immediately after leaving Juilliard in 1977, she took singing and jazz classes at a New York City–based YWCA, one of them taught by Joan Morton Lucas, who appeared in the film "Singin\' in the Rain" (1952) and the original Broadway production of "Kiss Me Kate".', 'She performed with the Princeton Ballet Company in "Peter and the Wolf", "The Nutcracker", and "Coppélia", also appearing in community theater musicals.', 'Studying acting for two years under Suzanne Shepard, Neuwirth made her Broadway debut in the role of Sheila in "A Chorus Line" in 1980.']
summary_sent: Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth is an American actress, singer, and dancer.
source: Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth Neuwirth was born in Newark, New Jersey. Immediately after leaving Juilliard in 1977, she took singing and jazz classes at a New York City–based YWCA, one of them taught by Joan Morton Lucas, who appeared in the film "Singin' in the Rain" (1952) and the original Broadway production of "Kiss Me Kate". She performed with the Princeton Ballet Company in "Peter and the Wolf", "The Nutcracker", and "Coppélia", also appearing in community theater musicals. Studying acting for two years under Suzanne Shepard, Neuwirth made her Broadway debut in the role of Sheila in "A Chorus Line" in 1980.

input_lines: ['Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth', 'Neuwirth was born in Newark, New Jersey.', 'Immediately after leaving Juilliard in 1977, she took singing and jazz classes at a New York City–based YWCA, one of them taught by Joan Morton Lucas, who appeared in the film "Singin\' in the Rain" (1952) and the original Broadway production of "Kiss Me Kate".', 'She performed with the Princeton Ballet Company in "Peter and the Wolf", "The Nutcracker", and "Coppélia", also appearing in community theater musicals.', 'Studying acting for two years under Suzanne Shepard, Neuwirth made her Broadway debut in the role of Sheila in "A Chorus Line" in 1980.']
summary_sent: Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth (; born December 31, 1958) is an American actress, singer, and dancer.
source: Beatrice "Bebe" Jane Neuwirth Neuwirth was born in Newark, New Jersey. Immediately after leaving Juilliard in 1977, she took singing and jazz classes at a New York City–based YWCA, one of them taught by Joan Morton Lucas, who appeared in the film "Singin' in the Rain" (1952) and the original Broadway production of "Kiss Me Kate". She performed with the Princeton Ballet Company in "Peter and the Wolf", "The Nutcracker", and "Coppélia", also appearing in community theater musicals. Studying acting for two years under Suzanne Shepard, Neuwirth made her Broadway debut in the role of Sheila in "A Chorus Line" in 1980.

input_lines: ['While in Los Angeles waiting to receive a Tony Award for her appearance in "Sweet Charity" in 1985, Neuwirth auditioned for the role of Dr. Lilith Sternin in the television series "Cheers".', "Neuwirth's character married Frasier Crane in the show.", 'From the fourth to the ninth season, Neuwirth portrayed Lilith in a regular recurring role, and she appeared on the show as a main star for both seasons ten and eleven.', 'The character also made an appearance in the series "Wings" and in 12 episodes of the "Cheers" spin-off "Frasier", which earned her a 1995 Emmy Award nomination as Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series.']
summary_sent: On television, she played Dr. Lilith Sternin, Frasier Crane's wife, on both the TV series "Cheers" (in a starring role) and its spin-off "Frasier" (in a recurring guest role).
source: While in Los Angeles waiting to receive a Tony Award for her appearance in "Sweet Charity" in 1985, Neuwirth auditioned for the role of Dr. Lilith Sternin in the television series "Cheers". Neuwirth's character married Frasier Crane in the show. From the fourth to the ninth season, Neuwirth portrayed Lilith in a regular recurring role, and she appeared on the show as a main star for both seasons ten and eleven. The character also made an appearance in the series "Wings" and in 12 episodes of the "Cheers" spin-off "Frasier", which earned her a 1995 Emmy Award nomination as Outstanding Guest Actress in a Comedy Series.

input_lines: ['Orly Levy-Abekasis', "Orly Levy was born in Beit She'an, Israel, to a Moroccan Jewish family.", 'For the 2013 elections, Levy-Abekasis was placed 16th on the Likud Yisrael Beiteinu list, and entered the Knesset after the party won 31 seats.', "For the 2021 elections, Levy-Abekasis was placed twenty-sixth on Likud's list and retained her seat in the Knesset, as Likud won thirty seats."]

source: Orly Levy-Abekasis Orly Levy was born in Beit She'an, Israel, to a Moroccan Jewish family. For the 2013 elections, Levy-Abekasis was placed 16th on the Likud Yisrael Beiteinu list, and entered the Knesset after the party won 31 seats. For the 2021 elections, Levy-Abekasis was placed twenty-sixth on Likud's list and retained her seat in the Knesset, as Likud won thirty seats.

input_lines: ['National Liberation Front (South Yemen)', 'The day after Aden joined the Federation Muhammad al-Badr of the Yemenese monarchy was overthrown and civil war ensued between forces backed by Nassar like the National Liberation Front (NLF) and monarchist forces backed by the Saudis and British.', 'This conflict spread throughout the region becoming what the British would term as the Aden Emergency which officially began when a state of emergency was declared in the State of Aden.', 'The anti-Royalist campaign for power spread to the "Federation of South Arabia" in 1964 when the NLF announced the start of their revolution.', 'However elements of the NLF become more radical Marxist and they split from the Egyptians.', 'On November 30, 1967 the "Federation of South Arabia" ceased to exist when the People\'s Republic of South Yemen was proclaimed.', 'The NLF changed its name to the Yemeni Socialist Party (YSP) in 1978.']
summary_sent: The National Liberation Front (NLF) was a Marxist paramilitary organization and a political party operating in the Federation of South Arabia, (now southern Yemen) during the Aden Emergency.
source: National Liberation Front (South Yemen) The day after Aden joined the Federation Muhammad al-Badr of the Yemenese monarchy was overthrown and civil war ensued between forces backed by Nassar like the National Liberation Front (NLF) and monarchist forces backed by the Saudis and British. This conflict spread throughout the region becoming what the British would term as the Aden Emergency which officially began when a state of emergency was declared in the State of Aden. The anti-Royalist campaign for power spread to the "Federation of South Arabia" in 1964 when the NLF announced the start of their revolution. However elements of the NLF become more radical Marxist and they split from the Egyptians. On November 30, 1967 the "Federation of South Arabia" ceased to exist when the People's Republic of South Yemen was proclaimed. The NLF changed its name to the Yemeni Socialist Party (YSP) in 1978.

input_lines: ['National Liberation Front (South Yemen)', 'The day after Aden joined the Federation Muhammad al-Badr of the Yemenese monarchy was overthrown and civil war ensued between forces backed by Nassar like the National Liberation Front (NLF) and monarchist forces backed by the Saudis and British.', 'This conflict spread throughout the region becoming what the British would term as the Aden Emergency which officially began when a state of emergency was declared in the State of Aden.', 'The anti-Royalist campaign for power spread to the "Federation of South Arabia" in 1964 when the NLF announced the start of their revolution.', 'However elements of the NLF become more radical Marxist and they split from the Egyptians.', 'On November 30, 1967 the "Federation of South Arabia" ceased to exist when the People\'s Republic of South Yemen was proclaimed.', 'The NLF changed its name to the Yemeni Socialist Party (YSP) in 1978.']
summary_sent: The National Liberation Front (NLF; ) was a Marxist paramilitary organization and a political party operating in the Federation of South Arabia, (now southern Yemen) during the Aden Emergency.
source: National Liberation Front (South Yemen) The day after Aden joined the Federation Muhammad al-Badr of the Yemenese monarchy was overthrown and civil war ensued between forces backed by Nassar like the National Liberation Front (NLF) and monarchist forces backed by the Saudis and British. This conflict spread throughout the region becoming what the British would term as the Aden Emergency which officially began when a state of emergency was declared in the State of Aden. The anti-Royalist campaign for power spread to the "Federation of South Arabia" in 1964 when the NLF announced the start of their revolution. However elements of the NLF become more radical Marxist and they split from the Egyptians. On November 30, 1967 the "Federation of South Arabia" ceased to exist when the People's Republic of South Yemen was proclaimed. The NLF changed its name to the Yemeni Socialist Party (YSP) in 1978.

input_lines: ['By February 1967 the British could no longer control or protect its bases in Aden and announced it was leaving the country, against American wishes.', 'FLOSY, now without any military support from its Egyptian ally, continued fighting the NLF.', 'Qahtan Muhammad al-Shaabi held the presidency until 22 June 1969, when a hard-line Marxist group from within his own NLF seized control.']
summary_sent: Following the exit of the British armed forces, the NLF seized power from its rival, FLOSY.
source: By February 1967 the British could no longer control or protect its bases in Aden and announced it was leaving the country, against American wishes. FLOSY, now without any military support from its Egyptian ally, continued fighting the NLF. Qahtan Muhammad al-Shaabi held the presidency until 22 June 1969, when a hard-line Marxist group from within his own NLF seized control.

source: By February 1967 the British could no longer control or protect its bases in Aden and announced it was leaving the country, against American wishes. FLOSY, now without any military support from its Egyptian ally, continued fighting the NLF. Qahtan Muhammad al-Shaabi held the presidency until 22 June 1969, when a hard-line Marxist group from within his own NLF seized control.

input_lines: ['William Emerson Arnett', 'Arnett was born in Toronto, Ontario, the son of Edith Alexandra "Alix" (Palk) and Emerson James "Jim" Arnett, who was a corporate lawyer and brewer, among other occupations.', 'In 2002, Arnett was cast in a fourth television pilot which was for the CBS sitcom "Still Standing", which was picked up and ran for several seasons, but his character was cut from the series after the pilot.', 'In March 2012, "Mansome", Arnett\'s first executive-producer credit with Bateman, was announced as a Spotlight selection for the Tribeca Film Festival.', 'He has also voiced characters in animated films, including Vlad in "Horton Hears a Who!', 'In July 2020, Arnett, along with Bateman and Sean Hayes, created a comedy and talk podcast called "SmartLess".']

source: William Emerson Arnett Arnett was born in Toronto, Ontario, the son of Edith Alexandra "Alix" (Palk) and Emerson James "Jim" Arnett, who was a corporate lawyer and brewer, among other occupations. In 2002, Arnett was cast in a fourth television pilot which was for the CBS sitcom "Still Standing", which was picked up and ran for several seasons, but his character was cut from the series after the pilot. In March 2012, "Mansome", Arnett's first executive-producer credit with Bateman, was announced as a Spotlight selection for the Tribeca Film Festival. He has also voiced characters in animated films, including Vlad in "Horton Hears a Who! In July 2020, Arnett, along with Bateman and Sean Hayes, created a comedy and talk podcast called "SmartLess".

input_lines: ['Oluwarotimi Odunayo Akeredolu', 'Akeredolu was born on 21 July 1956 in Owo to Reverend J. Ola Akeredolu of the Akeredolu family and', 'His middle name "Odunayo" means "Year of happiness" in Yoruba He went on to the University of Ife (now Obafemi Awolowo University) to study law, graduating in 1977.', 'He was referred to as the Nigerian Bar 1978.', 'In 1998, he became a Senior Advocate of Nigeria.', 'He was sworn in as the governor of Ondo State on 24 February 2017 in Akure, the Ondo State Capital.', 'On Saturday 10 October 2020, Akeredolu was re-elected Governor of Ondo State and announced by the Independent National Electoral Commission on 11 October 2020.']

source: Oluwarotimi Odunayo Akeredolu Akeredolu was born on 21 July 1956 in Owo to Reverend J. Ola Akeredolu of the Akeredolu family and His middle name "Odunayo" means "Year of happiness" in Yoruba He went on to the University of Ife (now Obafemi Awolowo University) to study law, graduating in 1977. He was referred to as the Nigerian Bar 1978. In 1998, he became a Senior Advocate of Nigeria. He was sworn in as the governor of Ondo State on 24 February 2017 in Akure, the Ondo State Capital. On Saturday 10 October 2020, Akeredolu was re-elected Governor of Ondo State and announced by the Independent National Electoral Commission on 11 October 2020.

In 1987, Portillo was given his first ministerial post, as Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Social Security; the following year, he was promoted to Minister of State for Transport. input_lines: ['Langenkamp became aware of auditions for a horror film known as "A Nightmare on Elm Street" (1984) in the winter of 1983.', 'She auditioned for the highly sought after role of fifteen-year-old heroine Nancy.', "Craven informed her that she got the part that winter, although shooting didn't begin until June 1984.", "Craven approached Langenkamp to reprise her role of Nancy in the sequel A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors (1987), about the survivors of Freddy Krueger's previous attempts; it opened to box office success in 1987 grossing over $44 million, and earned positive reviews.", 'Langenkamp returned to the "Elm Street" franchise with "Wes Craven\'s New Nightmare", which is a standalone film, and follows the journey Freddy Krueger takes to the real world.', 'She instead starred as a fictionalized version of herself, which was based on a stalking incident she was subject to that involved a fan angry over the cancellation of her show, "Just the Ten of Us".', '"Wes Craven\'s New Nightmare" was released in 1994, and opened to critical praise, being cited as an influential "metahorror" film.']
summary_sent: She is known for her performances as Nancy in "A Nightmare on Elm Street" (1984) and "A Nightmare on Elm Street 3 : Dream Warriors" (1987), and as a fictionalized version of herself in "Wes Craven's New Nightmare" (1994)—all a part of the "A Nightmare on Elm Street" franchise.
source: Langenkamp became aware of auditions for a horror film known as "A Nightmare on Elm Street" (1984) in the winter of 1983. She auditioned for the highly sought after role of fifteen-year-old heroine Nancy. Craven informed her that she got the part that winter, although shooting didn't begin until June 1984. Craven approached Langenkamp to reprise her role of Nancy in the sequel A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors (1987), about the survivors of Freddy Krueger's previous attempts; it opened to box office success in 1987 grossing over $44 million, and earned positive reviews. Langenkamp returned to the "Elm Street" franchise with "Wes Craven's New Nightmare", which is a standalone film, and follows the journey Freddy Krueger takes to the real world. She instead starred as a fictionalized version of herself, which was based on a stalking incident she was subject to that involved a fan angry over the cancellation of her show, "Just the Ten of Us". "Wes Craven's New Nightmare" was released in 1994, and opened to critical praise, being cited as an influential "metahorror" film.

Craven approached Langenkamp to reprise her role of Nancy in the sequel A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors (1987), about the survivors of Freddy Krueger's previous attempts; it opened to box office success in 1987 grossing over $44 million, and earned positive reviews. input_lines: ['Aurelio Pastor Valdivieso', 'He directs a law firm in the city of Lima specializing in criminal law, parliamentary law, electoral law and in the defense of human rights.', 'As a member of the Peruvian Aprista Party (APRA) he was National Secretary for Human Rights (1995–1999), National Secretary for Electoral Affairs and National Personero (1999–2000) and member of the Political Directorate from March 2010 to the present.', 'In the 2001 elections, he ran once again and was elected to Congress, representing the San Martín region.', 'In the 2006 elections, he was re-elected for a second term, once again representing the San Martin region.', 'In the 2011 election, he lost his seat when he ran for re-election, switching his seat in Lima.']
summary_sent: Aurelio Pastor Valdivieso is a Peruvian lawyer and politician and a former Congressman representing San Martín for the 2006-2011 term.
source: Aurelio Pastor Valdivieso He directs a law firm in the city of Lima specializing in criminal law, parliamentary law, electoral law and in the defense of human rights. As a member of the Peruvian Aprista Party (APRA) he was National Secretary for Human Rights (1995–1999), National Secretary for Electoral Affairs and National Personero (1999–2000) and member of the Political Directorate from March 2010 to the present. In the 2001 elections, he ran once again and was elected to Congress, representing the San Martín region. In the 2006 elections, he was re-elected for a second term, once again representing the San Martin region. In the 2011 election, he lost his seat when he ran for re-election, switching his seat in Lima.

input_lines: ['Aurelio Pastor Valdivieso', 'He directs a law firm in the city of Lima specializing in criminal law, parliamentary law, electoral law and in the defense of human rights.', 'As a member of the Peruvian Aprista Party (APRA) he was National Secretary for Human Rights (1995–1999), National Secretary for Electoral Affairs and National Personero (1999–2000) and member of the Political Directorate from March 2010 to the present.', 'In the 2001 elections, he ran once again and was elected to Congress, representing the San Martín region.', 'In the 2006 elections, he was re-elected for a second term, once again representing the San Martin region.', 'In the 2011 election, he lost his seat when he ran for re-election, switching his seat in Lima.']

In the 2001 elections, he ran once again and was elected to Congress, representing the San Martín region. In the 2006 elections, he was re-elected for a second term, once again representing the San Martin region. In the 2011 election, he lost his seat when he ran for re-election, switching his seat in Lima.

input_lines: ['Tropical Storm Usagi (2018)', "Continuing westwards, wind shear decreased, with the JTWC upgrading the system's tropical cyclone development potential within 24 hours to medium on November 14.", 'On November 18, at 03:00 UTC, 33W entered the Philippine Area of Responsibility and was assigned the local name "Samuel" by the PAGASA.', 'In preparation for the storm, the PAGASA raised signal #1 warnings in Visayas and Mindanao.', 'Usagi caused one death in the Philippines, with agricultural damages being estimated at ₱52.2 million (US$992,000).', 'A flood warning was also issued for the Central Highlands, the Southeast, and the provinces between Quảng Trị and Bình Thuận.', '60 roads were flooded in Ho Chi Minh City; three people were killed.', 'Losses in Vietnam were estimated at ₫925 billion (US$39.8 million).']
summary_sent: Severe Tropical Storm Usagi, known in the Philippines as Tropical Storm Samuel, was a tropical cyclone that affected the Philippines and Southern Vietnam in late November, causing severe damage around the Visayas region and Ho Chi Minh City.
source: Tropical Storm Usagi (2018) Continuing westwards, wind shear decreased, with the JTWC upgrading the system's tropical cyclone development potential within 24 hours to medium on November 14. On November 18, at 03:00 UTC, 33W entered the Philippine Area of Responsibility and was assigned the local name "Samuel" by the PAGASA. In preparation for the storm, the PAGASA raised signal #1 warnings in Visayas and Mindanao. Usagi caused one death in the Philippines, with agricultural damages being estimated at ₱52.2 million (US$992,000). A flood warning was also issued for the Central Highlands, the Southeast, and the provinces between Quảng Trị and Bình Thuận. 60 roads were flooded in Ho Chi Minh City; three people were killed. Losses in Vietnam were estimated at ₫925 billion (US$39.8 million).

input_lines: ['The PAGASA began monitoring the system, and on November 17, at 12:00 UTC, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical depression, assigning it the designation "33W".', 'On November 24, at 00:00 UTC, both the JMA and the JTWC estimated Usagi to have peaked, with the JMA estimating maximum 10-minute sustained winds of 110 kilometres per hour (70\xa0mph) alongside a minimum central pressure of 990\xa0hPa (29.23\xa0inHg) and the JTWC estimating maximum 1-minute sustained winds of 165 kilometres per hour (105\xa0mph).', 'Rainbands collapsed as the system turned northwest, and by November 25, both the JMA and the JTWC had downgraded Usagi to a tropical storm as central convection weakened.', 'Usagi made landfall on Vũng Tàu at 07:00 UTC, with the JTWC downgrading Usagi to a tropical depression later that day.', 'Usagi dissipated over Cambodia at 00:00 UTC on November 27.']
summary_sent: Usagi underwent rapid intensification and peaked in intensity before making its final landfall on Vũng Tàu as a weakening tropical storm on November 25.
source: The PAGASA began monitoring the system, and on November 17, at 12:00 UTC, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical depression, assigning it the designation "33W". On November 24, at 00:00 UTC, both the JMA and the JTWC estimated Usagi to have peaked, with the JMA estimating maximum 10-minute sustained winds of 110 kilometres per hour (70 mph) alongside a minimum central pressure of 990 hPa (29.23 inHg) and the JTWC estimating maximum 1-minute sustained winds of 165 kilometres per hour (105 mph). Rainbands collapsed as the system turned northwest, and by November 25, both the JMA and the JTWC had downgraded Usagi to a tropical storm as central convection weakened. Usagi made landfall on Vũng Tàu at 07:00 UTC, with the JTWC downgrading Usagi to a tropical depression later that day. Usagi dissipated over Cambodia at 00:00 UTC on November 27.

input_lines: ['The PAGASA began monitoring the system, and on November 17, at 12:00 UTC, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical depression, assigning it the designation "33W".', 'On November 24, at 00:00 UTC, both the JMA and the JTWC estimated Usagi to have peaked, with the JMA estimating maximum 10-minute sustained winds of 110 kilometres per hour (70\xa0mph) alongside a minimum central pressure of 990\xa0hPa (29.23\xa0inHg) and the JTWC estimating maximum 1-minute sustained winds of 165 kilometres per hour (105\xa0mph).', 'Rainbands collapsed as the system turned northwest, and by November 25, both the JMA and the JTWC had downgraded Usagi to a tropical storm as central convection weakened.', 'Usagi made landfall on Vũng Tàu at 07:00 UTC, with the JTWC downgrading Usagi to a tropical depression later that day.', 'Usagi dissipated over Cambodia at 00:00 UTC on November 27.']
summary_sent: Usagi underwent rapid intensification and peaked in intensity before making its final landfall on Vũng Tàu, Bà Rịa–Vũng Tàu province as a weakening tropical storm on November 25.
source: The PAGASA began monitoring the system, and on November 17, at 12:00 UTC, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical depression, assigning it the designation "33W". On November 24, at 00:00 UTC, both the JMA and the JTWC estimated Usagi to have peaked, with the JMA estimating maximum 10-minute sustained winds of 110 kilometres per hour (70 mph) alongside a minimum central pressure of 990 hPa (29.23 inHg) and the JTWC estimating maximum 1-minute sustained winds of 165 kilometres per hour (105 mph). Rainbands collapsed as the system turned northwest, and by November 25, both the JMA and the JTWC had downgraded Usagi to a tropical storm as central convection weakened. Usagi made landfall on Vũng Tàu at 07:00 UTC, with the JTWC downgrading Usagi to a tropical depression later that day. Usagi dissipated over Cambodia at 00:00 UTC on November 27.

source: Without further development on November 6, the disturbance moved out of the basin and into the West Pacific, where the system was first monitored by the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) at 22:00 UTC, assessing its potential of developing into a tropical cyclone within the next 24 hours as low. The JTWC upgraded Usagi to a typhoon later that day.

The JTWC upgraded Usagi to a typhoon later that day.

input_lines: ['But Cera successfully auditioned for a part in another Fox sitcom, "Arrested Development".', 'This began airing in November 2003 and ran for three seasons.', 'The show follows the formerly wealthy and dysfunctional Bluth family, with Cera playing George Michael Bluth, the teenage son of character Michael Bluth, played by Jason Bateman.', 'After three seasons, Fox canceled the series in 2006 due to low viewership, although it had received critical acclaim.', 'Cera starred in the Apatow-produced teen comedy "Superbad" alongside Jonah Hill.', '"Superbad" was released in cinemas in August 2007, topping the US box office for two weeks in a row.', 'In his second film of 2007, Cera co-starred in "Juno" as Paulie Bleeker, a teenager who has impregnated his long-time school friend Juno (played by Elliot Page).', "Cera was cast as Scott Pilgrim in the film adaptation of the graphic novel series by Bryan Lee O'Malley.", 'The film, "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World", follows Pilgrim, a musician who must battle the seven evil exes of his girlfriend Ramona (played by Mary Elizabeth Winstead).', 'It was released in cinemas in August 2010.', 'He played an exaggerated version of himself in the apocalyptic comedy film "This Is the End", which was released in summer of 2013 and featured his "Superbad" co-stars Jonah Hill and Seth Rogen.', 'Cera returned to his role as George Michael Bluth in the fifth season of "Arrested Development" in 2018.']
summary_sent: He has had numerous roles in television and film productions, including character George Michael Bluth on the sitcom "Arrested Development" (2003–2006 and again starting in 2018) and for his film roles in "Superbad" (2007), as Paulie Bleeker in "Juno" (2007), as Scott Pilgrim in "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World" (2010), and as a fictional version of himself in "This Is the End" (2013).
source: But Cera successfully auditioned for a part in another Fox sitcom, "Arrested Development". This began airing in November 2003 and ran for three seasons. The show follows the formerly wealthy and dysfunctional Bluth family, with Cera playing George Michael Bluth, the teenage son of character Michael Bluth, played by Jason Bateman. After three seasons, Fox canceled the series in 2006 due to low viewership, although it had received critical acclaim. Cera starred in the Apatow-produced teen comedy "Superbad" alongside Jonah Hill. "Superbad" was released in cinemas in August 2007, topping the US box office for two weeks in a row. In his second film of 2007, Cera co-starred in "Juno" as Paulie Bleeker, a teenager who has impregnated his long-time school friend Juno (played by Elliot Page). Cera was cast as Scott Pilgrim in the film adaptation of the graphic novel series by Bryan Lee O'Malley. The film, "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World", follows Pilgrim, a musician who must battle the seven evil exes of his girlfriend Ramona (played by Mary Elizabeth Winstead). It was released in cinemas in August 2010. He played an exaggerated version of himself in the apocalyptic comedy film "This Is the End", which was released in summer of 2013 and featured his "Superbad" co-stars Jonah Hill and Seth Rogen. Cera returned to his role as George Michael Bluth in the fifth season of "Arrested Development" in 2018.

input_lines: ['Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell', 'Bestebreurtje was born on May 3, 1925, in Berlin, Germany, to Dutch nationals; her father had been transferred by his firm to Berlin before her birth.', 'She joined the University of Colorado Health Sciences Center as a clinical professor of pediatrics.', 'Cantwell became one of the first physicians in the country to work for a child protection agency when she was hired by the Denver Department of Social Services (DDSS) in 1975.', 'Cantwell wrote a curriculum for court-ordered parenting education in 1975.', 'Thereafter she worked as a part-time consultant on child abuse and neglect for the Colorado State Department of Social Services, and continued to train nursing students, child advocates, and case workers to identify and assist child abuse victims.', 'In 1996 she and her husband formally retired and moved to Driggs, Idaho, near the ski slopes of the Teton Range.']
summary_sent: Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell (born May 3, 1925) is a German-born American retired physician, professor of pediatrics at the University of Colorado, advocate for abused and neglected children, and parenting educator.
source: Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell Bestebreurtje was born on May 3, 1925, in Berlin, Germany, to Dutch nationals; her father had been transferred by his firm to Berlin before her birth. She joined the University of Colorado Health Sciences Center as a clinical professor of pediatrics. Cantwell became one of the first physicians in the country to work for a child protection agency when she was hired by the Denver Department of Social Services (DDSS) in 1975. Cantwell wrote a curriculum for court-ordered parenting education in 1975. Thereafter she worked as a part-time consultant on child abuse and neglect for the Colorado State Department of Social Services, and continued to train nursing students, child advocates, and case workers to identify and assist child abuse victims. In 1996 she and her husband formally retired and moved to Driggs, Idaho, near the ski slopes of the Teton Range.

input_lines: ['Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell', 'Bestebreurtje was born on May 3, 1925, in Berlin, Germany, to Dutch nationals; her father had been transferred by his firm to Berlin before her birth.', 'She joined the University of Colorado Health Sciences Center as a clinical professor of pediatrics.', 'Cantwell became one of the first physicians in the country to work for a child protection agency when she was hired by the Denver Department of Social Services (DDSS) in 1975.', 'Cantwell wrote a curriculum for court-ordered parenting education in 1975.', 'Thereafter she worked as a part-time consultant on child abuse and neglect for the Colorado State Department of Social Services, and continued to train nursing students, child advocates, and case workers to identify and assist child abuse victims.', 'In 1996 she and her husband formally retired and moved to Driggs, Idaho, near the ski slopes of the Teton Range.']
summary_sent: Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell (born May 3, 1925) is a German-born American retired physician, professor emerita of pediatrics at the University of Colorado Denver, advocate for abused and neglected children, and parenting educator.
source: Hendrika Bestebreurtje Cantwell Bestebreurtje was born on May 3, 1925, in Berlin, Germany, to Dutch nationals; her father had been transferred by his firm to Berlin before her birth. She joined the University of Colorado Health Sciences Center as a clinical professor of pediatrics. Cantwell became one of the first physicians in the country to work for a child protection agency when she was hired by the Denver Department of Social Services (DDSS) in 1975. Cantwell wrote a curriculum for court-ordered parenting education in 1975. Thereafter she worked as a part-time consultant on child abuse and neglect for the Colorado State Department of Social Services, and continued to train nursing students, child advocates, and case workers to identify and assist child abuse victims. In 1996 she and her husband formally retired and moved to Driggs, Idaho, near the ski slopes of the Teton Range.

input_lines: ['In her 14 years of work with the DDSS, Cantwell came in contact with an estimated 30,000 cases of suspected child abuse and neglect.', 'She often served as an expert witness, with an estimated 95 percent of her court appearances coming on behalf of the prosecution.']
summary_sent: Her work there brought her in contact with an estimated 30,000 cases of suspected child abuse and she often testified as an expert witness.
source: In her 14 years of work with the DDSS, Cantwell came in contact with an estimated 30,000 cases of suspected child abuse and neglect. She often served as an expert witness, with an estimated 95 percent of her court appearances coming on behalf of the prosecution.

input_lines: ['Hoppus describes his mother as always supportive in his decisions to drop out of college and tour with Blink-182; however, he describes his father as "more realistic, [...] he said, \'Have something to fall back on.\'"', 'Hoppus penned the record\'s lead single, "Dammit", which became a nationwide rock radio hit single as the band toured on the Vans Warped Tour.', 'On 24 January 2019, Mark announced he was forming a new group with Alex Gaskarth of All Time Low called Simple Creatures.']
summary_sent: He is known as a member of the rock band Blink-182, as well as part of duo Simple Creatures with All Time Low member Alex Gaskarth.
source: Hoppus describes his mother as always supportive in his decisions to drop out of college and tour with Blink-182; however, he describes his father as "more realistic, [...] he said, 'Have something to fall back on.'" Hoppus penned the record's lead single, "Dammit", which became a nationwide rock radio hit single as the band toured on the Vans Warped Tour. On 24 January 2019, Mark announced he was forming a new group with Alex Gaskarth of All Time Low called Simple Creatures.
